sentence: The new executive who oversaw the middle managers apparently doubted himself on most major decisions
The popular sheriff who campaigned for the incumbent politicians never prepared himself for the new press briefing
The construction worker who argued with the shift leaders undeniably hurt himself on the construction site
The young caddy who escorted the experienced golfers supposedly dirtied himself by falling in the sand
The police officer who aided the brilliant detectives reportedly disguised himself to get more information
The football referee who argued with the large quarterbacks surprisingly excused themselves from the important game
The somber minister who conversed with the religious scholars usually presented themselves as very open-minded
The serious general who advised the new corporals seemingly committed themselves to the training regimen
The paranoid foreman who supervised the coal miners presumably saved themselves after the awful cave-in
The grimy blacksmith who worked for the royal knights evidently hurt themselves with the sharp tools
The ancient manuscript that the grad student who the new card catalog had confused a great deal was studying in the library was missing a page
The lullaby that the famous country singer who the record label had signed to a big contract was singing yesterday was written seventy years ago
The game that the child who the lawnmower had startled in the yard was playing in the morning lasted for hours
The crime that the gangster who the story had profiled had planned for weeks was quickly solved
The picture that the artist who the school had expelled for cheating was hurriedly copying was printed in a magazine
The trophy that the athlete who the restaurant had hired as a spokesman was stolen later
The apartment that the maid who the service had sent over was well decorated
The shirt that the seamstress who the immigration officer had investigated last week needed to be dry cleaned
The lecture that the professor who the newspaper story had just profiled in detail was not well attended
The novel that the horror author who the publishing company had recently fired was banned by the local library
More gym instructors won a marathon yesterday than lawyers did
More Americans began law school this week than Canadians did
This month more one-year-olds took their first steps than 10-month-olds did
Today more Brazilians immigrated to Japan than Chileans did
More 18-year-olds voted in this election than 40-year-olds did
More photographers won their third Pulitzer this year than the professor did
More girls graduated from high school last year than John did
This semester more foreign applicants got into Stanford than Marie did
More boys got an A on the exam yesterday than she did
Last month more couples had their second child than Sandra's sister did

These are the cakes that the pastry chefs who were participating in the competition baked
This is the girl that the boy who was working with the gardener courted her
This is the actress that the judge who was working at Cannes admired her
This is the mug that the artisans who were working with ceramics crafted it
This is the dictionary entry that the students who were doing the exam looked it up
This is the competition that the athletes who were feeling tired gave it up
No authors that the critics recommended have received any acknowledgment for a best-selling novel
No ambassadors that the diplomats consulted have ever seen brutality in the foreign war
No customers that the salesmen assisted have expressed any optimism for a full refund
No detergents that the housewives used have ever caused damage to the delicate clothing
No students that the teachers punished could expect any friendliness from the strict principal
The soldiers that no diplomats supported have shown any bravery in the controversial war
The professors that no students respected have ever wanted negativity in a class debate
The comments that no politicians ignored have caused any bitterness toward the liberal newspapers
The lawyers that no businessmen respected have ever received criticism for a bad trial
The babysitters that no children obeyed have shown any gratitude to the disappointed parents

I bought a nice small German electric bike
I washed an ugly wide American wool sweater
I painted a fine short Swedish wooden table

The key to the cabinets probably was destroyed by the fire
The picture on the fliers definitely was of a village church in the south of France
The label on the containers probably was a warning about the hazardous chemicals inside
The crime in the suburbs doubtlessly was a reflection of the violence in today's society
The entrance to the exhibits evidently was hard to locate on the diagram
The slogan on the posters unsurprisingly were designed to get attention
The mistake in the programs certainly were disastrous for the small software company
The problem in the stores ultimately were solved by firing the custodian
The defect in the appliances likely were unknown to consumers and government regulators
The door to the laboratories accidentally were left unlocked by the cleaning service
